dt: {bc}a chisel with a concavo-convex cross section
{bc}an excessive or improper charge for something {bc}{sx|extortion||}

et: Middle English {it}gowge{/it}, from Middle French {it}gouge{/it}, from Late Latin {it}gulbia{/it}
shortdef: a chisel with a concavo-convex cross section
a groove or cavity scooped out

dt: {bc}to scoop out with or as if with a gouge {dx_def}see {dxt|gouge:1||1}{/dx_def}
{bc}to force out (an eye) with the thumb
{bc}to thrust the thumb into the eye of
{bc}to make (someone) pay too much for something {bc}{sx|overcharge||}

shortdef: to scoop out with or as if with a gouge
to force out (an eye) with the thumb
to thrust the thumb into the eye of

dt.t: The impact of the accident {it}gouged{/it} a big piece {it}out{/it} of the wall.

dt: {bc}to make (a hole or path) by digging or cutting

dt.t: The river {it}gouged out{/it} a wide path between the mountains.

shortdef: to remove (something) by digging or cutting
to make (a hole or path) by digging or cutting
